1"""Flexible method to load confounds generated by fMRIprep.""" 

2 

3import warnings 

4 

5import pandas as pd 

6 

7from nilearn._utils.logger import find_stack_level 

8from nilearn._utils.param_validation import check_parameter_in_allowed 

9from nilearn.interfaces.fmriprep import load_confounds_components as components 

10from nilearn.interfaces.fmriprep.load_confounds_utils import ( 

11 MissingConfoundError, 

12 get_confounds_file, 

13 get_json, 

14 load_confounds_file_as_dataframe, 

15 load_confounds_json, 

16 prepare_output, 

17 sanitize_confounds, 

18) 

19 

20# Global variables listing the admissible types of noise components 

21all_confounds = [ 

22 "motion", 

23 "high_pass", 

24 "wm_csf", 

25 "global_signal", 

26 "compcor", 

27 "ica_aroma", 

28 "tedana", 

29 "scrub", 

30 "non_steady_state", 

31] 

32 

33# extra parameters needed for each noise component 

34component_parameters = { 

35 "motion": ["motion"], 

36 "wm_csf": ["wm_csf"], 

37 "global_signal": ["global_signal"], 

38 "compcor": ["meta_json", "compcor", "n_compcor"], 

39 "ica_aroma": ["ica_aroma"], 

40 "tedana": ["tedana"], 

41 "scrub": ["scrub", "fd_threshold", "std_dvars_threshold"], 

42} 

43 

44 

45def _check_strategy(strategy): 

46 """Ensure the denoising strategies combinations are valid. 

47 

48 Parameters 

49 ---------- 

50 strategy : :obj:`tuple` or :obj:`list` of :obj:`str`. 

51 See :func:`nilearn.interfaces.fmriprep.load_confounds` for details. 

52 

53 Raises 

54 ------ 

55 ValueError 

56 If any of the confounds specified in the strategy are not supported, 

57 or the combination of the strategies are not valid. 

58 """ 

59 if (not isinstance(strategy, tuple)) and (not isinstance(strategy, list)): 

60 raise ValueError( 

61 "strategy needs to be a tuple or list of strings" 

62 f" A {strategy.__class__.__name__} was provided instead." 

63 ) 

64 

65 if len(strategy) == 0: 

66 warnings.warn( 

67 "strategy is empty, confounds will return None.", 

68 stacklevel=find_stack_level(), 

69 ) 

70 

71 for conf in strategy: 

72 if conf == "non_steady_state": 

73 warnings.warn( 

74 "Non-steady state volumes are always detected. It " 

75 "doesn't need to be supplied as part of the " 

76 "strategy. Supplying non_steady_state in strategy " 

77 "will not have additional effect.", 

78 stacklevel=find_stack_level(), 

79 ) 

80 check_parameter_in_allowed(conf, all_confounds, "confounds") 

81 

82 # high pass filtering must be present if using fmriprep compcor outputs 

83 if ("compcor" in strategy) and ("high_pass" not in strategy): 

84 raise ValueError( 

85 "When using compcor, `high_pass` must be included in " 

86 f"strategy. Current strategy: '{strategy}'" 

87 ) 

88 

89 

90def _check_error(missing): 

91 """Consolidate a single error message across multiple missing confounds.""" 

92 if missing["confounds"] or missing["keywords"]: 

93 error_msg = ( 

94 "The following keywords or parameters are missing: " 

95 f" {missing['confounds']}" 

96 f" {missing['keywords']}" 

97 ". You may want to try a different denoising strategy." 

98 ) 

99 raise ValueError(error_msg) 

100 

101 

102def load_confounds( 

103 img_files, 

104 strategy=("motion", "high_pass", "wm_csf"), 

105 motion="full", 

106 scrub=5, 

107 fd_threshold=0.5, 

108 std_dvars_threshold=1.5, 

109 wm_csf="basic", 

110 global_signal="basic", 

111 compcor="anat_combined", 

112 n_compcor="all", 

113 ica_aroma="full", 

114 tedana="aggressive", 

115 demean=True, 

116): 

117 """ 

118 Use confounds from :term:`fMRIPrep`. 

119 

120 To enable easy confound variables loading from :term:`fMRIPrep` outputs, 

121 `load_confounds` provides an interface that groups subsets of confound 

122 variables into noise components and their parameters. It is possible to 

123 fine-tune a subset of noise components and their parameters through this 

124 function. 

125 

126 The implementation will only support :term:`fMRIPrep` functional derivative 

127 directory from the 1.2.x series. The `compcor` noise component requires 

128 1.4.x series or above. 

129 

130 .. nilearn_versionadded:: 0.9.0 

131 

132 Parameters 

133 ---------- 

134 img_files : :obj:`str` or :obj:`list` of :obj:`str` 

135 Path of processed nii.gz/dtseries.nii/func.gii file reside in a 

136 :term:`fMRIPrep` generated functional derivative directory (i.e.The 

137 associated confound files should be in the same directory as the image 

138 file). As long as the image file, confound related tsv and json are in 

139 the same directory with BIDS-complied names, `load_confounds` can 

140 retrieve the relevant files correctly. 

141 

142 - `nii.gz` or `dtseries.nii`: path to files, optionally as a list. 

143 - `func.gii`: list of a pair of paths to files, optionally as a list 

144 of lists. 

145 

146 strategy : :obj:`tuple` or :obj:`list` of :obj:`str`, \ 

147 default=("motion", "high_pass", "wm_csf") 

148 The type of noise components to include. 

149 

150 - "motion": head motion estimates. Associated parameter: `motion` 

151 - "wm_csf" confounds derived from white matter and cerebrospinal fluid. 

152 Associated parameter: `wm_csf` 

153 - "global_signal" confounds derived from the global signal. 

154 Associated parameter: `global_signal` 

155 - "compcor" confounds derived from CompCor (:footcite:t:`Behzadi2007`). 

156 When using this noise component, "high_pass" must also be applied. 

157 Associated parameter: `compcor`, `n_compcor` 

158 - "ica_aroma" confounds derived 

159 from ICA-AROMA (:footcite:t:`Pruim2015`). 

160 Associated parameter: `ica_aroma` 

161 - "tedana" confounds derived from TEDANA (:footcite:t:`DuPre2021`). 

162 - "scrub" regressors for :footcite:t:`Power2014` scrubbing approach. 

163 Associated parameter: `scrub`, `fd_threshold`, `std_dvars_threshold` 

164 

165 For each component above, associated parameters will be applied if 

166 specified. If associated parameters are not specified, any values 

167 supplied to the parameters are ignored. 

168 For example, `strategy=('motion', 'global_signal')` will allow users 

169 to supply input to associated parameter `motion` and `global_signal`; 

170 if users pass `wm_csf` parameter, it will not be applied as it is not 

171 part of the `strategy`. 

172 

173 There are two additional noise components with no optional parameters. 

174 

175 - "non_steady_state" denotes volumes collected before 

176 the :term:`fMRI` scanner has reached a stable state. 

177 - "high_pass" adds discrete cosines transformation 

178 basis regressors to handle low-frequency signal drifts. 

179 

180 Non-steady-state volumes will always be checked. There's no need to 

181 supply this component to the strategy. 

182 

183 motion : :obj:`str`, default="full" 

184 Type of confounds extracted from head motion estimates. 

185 

186 - "basic" translation/rotation (6 parameters) 

187 - "power2" translation/rotation + quadratic terms (12 parameters) 

188 - "derivatives" translation/rotation + derivatives (12 parameters) 

189 - "full" translation/rotation + derivatives + quadratic terms + power2d 

190 derivatives (24 parameters) 

191 

192 wm_csf : :obj:`str`, default="basic" 

193 Type of confounds extracted from masks of white matter and 

194 cerebrospinal fluids. 

195 

196 - "basic" the averages in each mask (2 parameters) 

197 - "power2" averages and quadratic terms (4 parameters) 

198 - "derivatives" averages and derivatives (4 parameters) 

199 - "full" averages + derivatives + quadratic terms + power2d derivatives 

200 (8 parameters) 

201 

202 global_signal : :obj:`str`, default="basic" 

203 Type of confounds extracted from the global signal. 

204 

205 - "basic" just the global signal (1 parameter) 

206 - "power2" global signal and quadratic term (2 parameters) 

207 - "derivatives" global signal and derivative (2 parameters) 

208 - "full" global signal + derivatives + quadratic terms + power2d 

209 derivatives (4 parameters) 

210 

211 scrub : :obj:`int`, default=5 

212 After accounting for time frames with excessive motion, further remove 

213 segments shorter than the given number. The default value is referred 

214 as full scrubbing in :footcite:t:`Power2014`. When the value is 0, 

215 remove time frames based on excessive framewise displacement and 

216 DVARS only. 

217 

218 fd_threshold : :obj:`float`, default=0.5 

219 

220 .. nilearn_versionchanged:: 0.13.0dev 

221 The default was changed from ``0.2`` to ``0.5``. 

222 

223 Framewise displacement threshold for scrub in mm. 

224 

225 std_dvars_threshold : :obj:`float`, default=1.5 

226 

227 .. nilearn_versionchanged:: 0.13.0dev 

228 The default value will be changed from ``3.0`` to ``1.5``. 

229 

230 Standardized DVARS threshold for scrub. 

231 The default threshold matching :term:`fMRIPrep`. 

232 DVARs is defined as root mean squared intensity difference of volume N 

233 to volume N+1 :footcite:t:`Power2012`. 

234 D referring to temporal derivative of timecourses, 

235 VARS referring to root mean squared variance over voxels. 

236 

237 compcor : :obj:`str`, default="anat_combined" 

238 

239 .. warning:: 

240 Require :term:`fMRIPrep` >= v:1.4.0. 

241 

242 Type of confounds extracted from a component based noise correction 

243 method :footcite:t:`Behzadi2007`. 

244 

245 - "anat_combined" noise components calculated using a white matter and 

246 CSF combined anatomical mask 

247 - "anat_separated" noise components calculated using white matter mask 

248 and CSF mask compcor separately; two sets of scores are concatenated 

249 - "temporal" noise components calculated using temporal compcor 

250 - "temporal_anat_combined" components of "temporal" and "anat_combined" 

251 - "temporal_anat_separated" components of "temporal" and 

252 "anat_separated" 

253 

254 n_compcor : :obj:`str` or :obj:`int`, default="all" 

255 The number of noise components to be extracted. 

256 For acompcor_combined=False, and/or compcor="full", this is the number 

257 of components per mask. 

258 "all": select all components (50% variance explained by 

259 :term:`fMRIPrep` defaults) 

260 

261 ica_aroma : :obj:`str`, default="full" 

262 

263 - "full": use :term:`fMRIPrep` output 

264 `~desc-smoothAROMAnonaggr_bold.nii.gz`. 

265 - "basic": use noise independent components only. 

266 

267 tedana : :obj:`str`, default="aggressive" 

268 

269 - "aggressive": use :term:`Tedana` tedana optimally combined 

270 image output. 

271 `~desc-optcom_bold.nii.gz`. 

272 If aggressive is selected all the components classified as 

273 rejected by tedana will be returned as a pandas DataFrame 

274 - "non-aggressive": use :term:`Tedana` tedana optimally combined 

275 image output. 

276 `~desc-optcom_bold.nii.gz`. 

277 If non-aggresive is selected all the components classified as 

278 either rejected or accepted will be returned as a pandas DataFrame 

279 

280 

281 

282 demean : :obj:`bool`, default=True 

283 If True, the confounds are standardized to a zero mean (over time). 

284 When using :class:`nilearn.maskers.NiftiMasker` with default 

285 parameters, the recommended option is True. 

286 When using :func:`nilearn.signal.clean` with default parameters, the 

287 recommended option is False. 

288 When `sample_mask` is not None, the mean is calculated on retained 

289 volumes. 

290 

291 Returns 

292 ------- 

293 confounds : :class:`pandas.DataFrame`, or :obj:`list` of \ 

294 :class:`pandas.DataFrame` 

295 A reduced version of :term:`fMRIPrep` confounds based on selected 

296 strategy and flags. 

297 Or a reduced version of the :term:`Tedana` confounds based on the 

298 strategy and flags. 

299 The columns contains the labels of the regressors. 

300 

301 sample_mask : None, :class:`numpy.ndarray` or, :obj:`list` of \ 

302 :class:`numpy.ndarray` or None 

303 When no volumns require removal, the value is None. 

304 Otherwise, shape: (number of scans - number of volumes removed, ) 

305 The index of the niimgs along time/fourth dimension for valid volumes 

306 for subsequent analysis. 

307 This attribute should be passed to parameter `sample_mask` of 

308 :class:`nilearn.maskers.NiftiMasker` or 

309 :func:`nilearn.signal.clean`. 

310 Volumns are removed if flagged as following: 

311 

312 - Non-steady-state volumes (if present) 

313 - Motion outliers detected by scrubbing 

314 

315 Notes 

316 ----- 

317 The noise components implemented in this class are adapted from 

318 :footcite:t:`Ciric2017`. Band-pass filter is replaced by high-pass filter. 

319 Low-pass filters can be implemented, e.g., through `NifitMaskers`. 

320 Other aspects of the preprocessing listed 

321 in :footcite:t:`Ciric2017` are controlled 

322 through :term:`fMRIPrep`, e.g. distortion correction. 

323 

324 See Also 

325 -------- 

326 :func:`nilearn.interfaces.fmriprep.load_confounds_strategy` 

327 

328 References 

329 ---------- 

330 .. footbibliography:: 

331 

332 """ 

333 _check_strategy(strategy) 

334 

335 if "tedana" in strategy and len(strategy) > 1: 

336 tedana_warning = ( 

337 "TEDANA strategy will only look for the ~desc-ICA_mixing.tsv " 

338 "and the ~desc-tedana_metrics.tsv for the provided " 

339 "~desc-optcom_bold.nii.gz from the tedana folder " 

340 "to load the rejected ICA confounds. Other strategies: \n" 

341 f"{[s for s in strategy if 'tedana' not in s]} " 

342 "will NOT be applied for the Tedana confounds." 

343 ) 

344 warnings.warn( 

345 category=UserWarning, 

346 message=tedana_warning, 

347 stacklevel=find_stack_level(), 

348 ) 

349 

350 # load confounds per image provided 

351 img_files, flag_single = sanitize_confounds(img_files) 

352 confounds_out = [] 

353 sample_mask_out = [] 

354 for file in img_files: 

355 sample_mask, conf = _load_confounds_for_single_image_file( 

356 file, 

357 strategy, 

358 demean, 

359 motion=motion, 

360 scrub=scrub, 

361 fd_threshold=fd_threshold, 

362 std_dvars_threshold=std_dvars_threshold, 

363 wm_csf=wm_csf, 

364 global_signal=global_signal, 

365 compcor=compcor, 

366 n_compcor=n_compcor, 

367 ica_aroma=ica_aroma, 

368 tedana=tedana, 

369 ) 

370 confounds_out.append(conf) 

371 sample_mask_out.append(sample_mask) 

372 

373 # If a single input was provided, 

374 # send back a single output instead of a list 

375 if flag_single: 

376 confounds_out = confounds_out[0] 

377 sample_mask_out = sample_mask_out[0] 

378 

379 # If no strategy was provided, return None for confounds 

380 if len(strategy) == 0: 

381 confounds_out = None 

382 

383 return confounds_out, sample_mask_out 

384 

385 

386def _load_confounds_for_single_image_file( 

387 image_file, strategy, demean, **kwargs 

388): 

389 """Load confounds for a single image file. 

390 

391 Parameters 

392 ---------- 

393 image_file : :obj:`str` 

394 Path to processed image file. 

395 

396 strategy : :obj:`tuple` or :obj:`list` of :obj:`str`. 

397 See :func:`nilearn.interfaces.fmriprep.load_confounds` for details. 

398 

399 demean : :obj:`bool`, default=True 

400 See :func:`nilearn.interfaces.fmriprep.load_confounds` for details. 

401 

402 kwargs : :obj:`dict` 

403 Extra relevant parameters for the given `strategy`. 

404 See :func:`nilearn.interfaces.fmriprep.load_confounds` for details. 

405 

406 Returns 

407 ------- 

408 sample_mask : None, :class:`numpy.ndarray` or, :obj:`list` of \ 

409 :class:`numpy.ndarray` or None 

410 See :func:`nilearn.interfaces.fmriprep.load_confounds` for details. 

411 

412 confounds : :class:`pandas.DataFrame`, or :obj:`list` of \ 

413 :class:`pandas.DataFrame` 

414 See :func:`nilearn.interfaces.fmriprep.load_confounds` for details. 

415 """ 

416 # Check for ica_aroma in strategy, this will change the required image_file 

417 flag_full_aroma = ("ica_aroma" in strategy) and ( 

418 kwargs.get("ica_aroma") == "full" 

419 ) 

420 # Check for tedana 

421 flag_tedana = ("tedana" in strategy) and (kwargs.get("tedana")) 

422 

423 # make sure that if you use tedana we uset flag_full_aroma 

424 if flag_tedana: 

425 flag_full_aroma = False 

426 

427 confounds_file = get_confounds_file( 

428 image_file, flag_full_aroma=flag_full_aroma, flag_tedana=flag_tedana 

429 ) 

430 confounds_json_file = get_json(confounds_file, flag_tedana=flag_tedana) 

431 

432 return _load_single_confounds_file( 

433 confounds_file=confounds_file, 

434 strategy=strategy, 

435 demean=demean, 

436 confounds_json_file=confounds_json_file, 

437 **kwargs, 

438 ) 

439 

440 

441def _load_single_confounds_file( 

442 confounds_file, strategy, demean=True, confounds_json_file=None, **kwargs 

443): 

444 """Load and extract specified confounds from the confounds file. 

445 

446 Parameters 

447 ---------- 

448 confounds_file : :obj:`str` 

449 Path to confounds file. 

450 

451 strategy : :obj:`tuple` or :obj:`list` of :obj:`str`. 

452 See :func:`nilearn.interfaces.fmriprep.load_confounds` for details. 

453 

454 demean : :obj:`bool`, default=True 

455 See :func:`nilearn.interfaces.fmriprep.load_confounds` for details. 

456 

457 confounds_json_file : :obj:`str`, default=None 

458 Path to confounds json file. 

459 

460 kwargs : :obj:`dict` 

461 Extra relevant parameters for the given `strategy`. 

462 See :func:`nilearn.interfaces.fmriprep.load_confounds` for details. 

463 

464 Returns 

465 ------- 

466 confounds : :class:`pandas.DataFrame` 

467 See :func:`nilearn.interfaces.fmriprep.load_confounds` for details. 

468 

469 Raises 

470 ------ 

471 ValueError 

472 If any of the confounds specified in the strategy are not found in the 

473 confounds file or confounds json file. 

474 """ 

475 flag_acompcor = ("compcor" in strategy) and ( 

476 "anat" in kwargs.get("compcor") 

477 ) 

478 flag_tedana = ("tedana" in strategy) and (kwargs.get("tedana")) 

479 

480 missing = {"confounds": [], "keywords": []} 

481 # tedana will load multiple files so we need to handle if 

482 # before loading "regular" confounds from other sources 

483 

484 # Convert tsv file to pandas dataframe 

485 confounds_all = load_confounds_file_as_dataframe( 

486 confounds_file, flag_tedana=flag_tedana 

487 ) 

488 

489 if confounds_json_file is None: 

490 confounds_json_file = get_json(confounds_file) 

491 

492 # Read the associated json file 

493 meta_json = load_confounds_json( 

494 confounds_json_file, flag_acompcor=flag_acompcor 

495 ) 

496 

497 # always check non steady state volumes are loaded 

498 confounds_select, missing = _load_noise_component( 

499 confounds_all, 

500 "non_steady_state", 

501 missing, 

502 meta_json=meta_json, 

503 **kwargs, 

504 ) 

505 

506 # clean out the other strategies as tedana will only work with files from 

507 # tedana output and no cross-functionality has been coded 

508 strategy = ["tedana"] if "tedana" in strategy else strategy 

509 for component in strategy: 

510 loaded_confounds, missing = _load_noise_component( 

511 confounds_all, component, missing, meta_json=meta_json, **kwargs 

512 ) 

513 confounds_select = pd.concat( 

514 [confounds_select, loaded_confounds], axis=1 

515 ) 

516 

517 _check_error(missing) # raise any missing 

518 return prepare_output(confounds_select, demean) 

519 

520 

521def _load_noise_component(confounds_raw, component, missing, **kargs): 

522 """Load confound of a single noise component. 

523 

524 Parameters 

525 ---------- 

526 confounds_raw : :class:`pandas.DataFrame` 

527 The confounds loaded from the confounds file. 

528 

529 component : :obj:`str` 

530 The noise component to be loaded. The item from the strategy list. 

531 

532 missing : :obj:`dict` 

533 A dictionary of missing confounds and noise component keywords. 

534 

535 kargs : :obj:`dict` 

536 Extra relevant parameters for the given `component`. 

537 See :func:`nilearn.interfaces.fmriprep.load_confounds` for details. 

538 

539 Returns 

540 ------- 

541 loaded_confounds : :class:`pandas.DataFrame` 

542 The confounds loaded from the confounds file for the given component. 

543 

544 missing : :obj:`dict` 

545 A dictionary of missing confounds and noise component keywords. 

546 

547 Raises 

548 ------ 

549 MissingConfoundError 

550 If any of the confounds specified in the strategy are not found in the 

551 confounds file or confounds json file. 

552 """ 

553 try: 

554 need_params = component_parameters.get(component) 

555 if need_params: 

556 params = {param: kargs.get(param) for param in need_params} 

557 loaded_confounds = getattr(components, f"_load_{component}")( 

558 confounds_raw, **params 

559 ) 

560 else: 

561 loaded_confounds = getattr(components, f"_load_{component}")( 

562 confounds_raw 

563 ) 

564 except MissingConfoundError as exception: 

565 missing["confounds"] += exception.params 

566 missing["keywords"] += exception.keywords 

567 loaded_confounds = pd.DataFrame() 

568 return loaded_confounds, missing 

« prev     ^ index     » next       coverage.py v7.12.0, created at 2025-12-05 17:56 +0100
